intro: Froelichia interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted froelichia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of water bodies, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Froelichia interrupta is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to periodic flooding.
